alert.note: Alert for Gallia; Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong line of thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Meigs, southeastern Gallia, northwestern Calhoun, Kanawha, Putnam, Lincoln, Wirt, Roane, northwestern Wyoming, Jackson, eastern Wayne, Mason, Cabell, southwestern Ritchie, Mingo, Logan and Boone Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1211 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong line of thunderstorms from Racine to just east of Kermit, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Ripley, Williamson, Madison, Spencer, Winfield, Logan, Hamlin, Elizabeth, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Barboursville, Ravenswood and Sissonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 18. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 157. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 19 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 85 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
